items.title: Sensing with a twist: A new kind of optical nanosensor uses torque for signal processing
items.summary: As electronic devices get smaller, their ability to provide precise, chip-based sensing of dynamic physical properties such as motion become challenging to develop. An international group of researchers have put a literal twist on this challenge, demonstrating a new nanoscale optomechanical resonator that can detect torsional motion at near state-of-the-art sensitivity. Their resonator, into which they couple light, also demonstrates torsional frequency mixing, a novel ability to impact optical energies using mechanical motions.

alternate.title: Sensing with a twist: A new kind of optical nanosensor uses torque for signal processing

thumbnail.title: Sensing with a twist: A new kind of optical nanosensor uses torque for signal processing

items.title: Fertility research brings death of dogma, birth of hope
items.summary: A new study shows unequivocally that stem cells in the ovaries are a critical piece of the mammal fertility puzzle, and may be harnessed to revolutionize fertility treatments and perhaps even delay menopause.

alternate.title: Fertility research brings death of dogma, birth of hope

items.title: Tracing the light inside a LED
items.summary: The performance of white LED's can be improved, based on better knowledge of the absorption and scattering of light inside the LED. A new method can lead to efficiency improvement and powerful design tools.

alternate.title: Tracing the light inside a LED

thumbnail.title: Tracing the light inside a LED

items.title: Differences in aggression among people with dementia
items.summary: Physical aggression among people with dementia is not unusual. A study showed that one-third of patients with the diagnosis Alzheimer’s disease or frontotemporal dementia were physically aggressive towards healthcare staff, other patients, relatives, animals and complete strangers. This manifestation of disease must be both understood and addressed in the right way.

alternate.title: Differences in aggression among people with dementia

items.title: Teens come 'jet lagged' to school: Shifting sleeping patterns at weekends
items.summary: A lack of sleep is associated with more absence and teens turn up jet lagged to school on Mondays, as shown in new research.

alternate.title: Teens come 'jet lagged' to school: Shifting sleeping patterns at weekends

items.title: Innate immunity: To operate, insert dimers
items.summary: The presence of DNA in mammalian cell cytoplasm triggers an immune response by binding to a dimeric enzyme, which inserts between DNA double helices to form the “rungs” of a ladder-like structure, as an LMU team has now shown.

alternate.title: Innate immunity: To operate, insert dimers

thumbnail.title: Innate immunity: To operate, insert dimers

items.title: Secrets of Bonsai: Uncovering the mechanism of root regeneration
items.summary: The molecular mechanism behind root regeneration after root cutting in plants has been discovered. A finding which could lead to the development of new methods for regulating plant growth in agriculture and horticulture.

alternate.title: Secrets of Bonsai: Uncovering the mechanism of root regeneration

thumbnail.title: Secrets of Bonsai: Uncovering the mechanism of root regeneration
